comments.commentBody: This has got to be the dirtiest election run by Republicans ever.  They have  hit so low that it sometimes takes my breath away.  The question is why do so many people fall for such blatant lies.

"the Republicans impeachment threat demonstrates their gathering disrespect for democracy." Gathering? Undermining democracy has been the Republican party plan for victory for years. How else for a minority to rule in a democracy- gerrymandering and voter suppression work wonders. Not only does the party threaten to make life painful for the citizenry, but what qualified person in their right mind would subject herself or himself to such endless persecution. No, the strategy has long been to subvert competent and successful candidates like President Obama and the Clintons with endless accusations in order to be left only with less effective candidates who can be defeated at the polls.

Everyone I know has gone mad trying to parse the reasons anyone could vote for Trump. This new insanity, which is just another example of Trump’s style: all bullying and threats, all the time—fits right in with what I now believe is the main reason for his core support. It’s much simpler than the pundits’ claims.

Trump has taken what his supporters believe has been forced into secrecy and darkness by a liberal culture and made it public. He mirrors what people have been feeling and thinking for decades, if not for generations. Many Trump supporters have felt shackled by their idea of a "PC" bias that forbids them from speaking their own truths. For them, FINALLY, there's someone who actually says the racist, nativist, xenophobic, misogynist stuff they feel strongly and say in private. No more dog whistles and code language-- that didn't cut it-- now it's explicit, it's part of the national conversation. This is a validation of everything that's important to them.

Their reasons are various-- bitterness, envy, blaming others, valid economic struggles, misunderstanding of policy, deep racism-- but Trump is their hero for shouting from the rooftops their innermost deeply felt beliefs.

It's identity politics. Nothing Trump says or does that seems indescribably indecent and preposterous to others, means anything to them. They will excuse and justify all of it. In fact, they love it. These folks feel someone finally gets them, and that's all that matters.

I used to think Republicans would merely try to prevent Clinton from accomplishing anything should she win. That they would take the same approach to "governing" they've taken during the Obama presidency. Now I'm afraid they will actively try to destroy our democracy.

Republicans are primarily to blame for many of the problems in America. Now they have the gall to say only they can fix the country.

They must not be allowed to reduce our democracy to rubble. Democrats must make it clear how dangerous and subversive they are. Republican extremists in Congress must be marginalized. If there are any moderate Republicans, or even "normal" conservatives, they must be convinced to work with Clinton and the Democrats for the good of the country.

So far they haven't shown much backbone in rejecting Trump and his anti-democratic agenda. We better fasten out seat belts, it's going to be a bumpy ride.

Last I heard when a U.S. President is impeached and convicted the next person in line is the Vice President.  In a Hillary administration that would be Tim Kaine. How does that become a Republican victory?

If Trump had never lived, this Congress would impeach a President Hillary.

They'd do that for any good reason, any bad reason, or with no articulate reason at all. It is not because of Trump. If he says it, it is only saying the obvious.

As for endless investigations of Hillary, is there any doubt about that? Does ANYONE doubt that? That has nothing to do with Trump.

What Trump says about that is simple fact, and we all know it.

We are seeing exactly the same techniques that we see in new and emerging democracies where the new leaders don't actually understand, believe in, or respect their Constitution, because NOTHING matters other than gain power by any means. We are seeing the dirtiest and most treacherous election ever, yet the victims are the ones accused of rigging.
It's not Democrats who are telling people they can vote by texting using phony ads "paid by Hillary".
It's not Democrats gaming voting rolls in NC with a gimicked phony mailer.
It's not Democrats that closed both registration and polling places in Democratic-Majority areas.
It's not Democrats who are sending para-military "poll watchers" out to intimidate voters into not voting.
It's not Democrats who are leaking damaging innuendos from within the FBI, which is supposed to be neutral.
It wasn't a Democratic FBI Director who 11 days before the election (violating the 60 day rule), using vague statements made the election a referendum on Hillary Clinton instead of Donald Trump.
It's not a Dem supporter who is hacking ONLY Democratic emails, cherry-picking and altering them.

Yeah, the Republicans and Trump's hero, Putin, are doing EVERYTHING they can to rig our American election.

As I reminded the NY Times Editorial Board a few weeks ago,

I will do so again:

We are not a Democracy.

We are a Republic.

Those who wrote the Constitution never imagined a Supreme Court
that would consider its duty to make Social Policy and to create New Laws.

It meant for Congress to be the Superior Power - not the Federal Government
as mandated by Presidential Decree.

Liberal Progressives wish that we were a Federal Democracy but we are not -
We are a Union of States under a Republican form of Government.

The Constitution gives Congress the last word - not the President, not the
Supreme Court - unless the States convene a Constitutional Amendment.

If Congress wishes to negate most of the authority of the President,
it has a Constitutional Right to do so and if the Congress wishes to
Impeach the President and remove him/her from office - it can.

Democrats should be worried that Hillary, who brooks no objections,
respects no rules that might limit her freedom to do as she sees fit
and avoids telling the simple truth when her actions violate the law -
may well paint herself into an impeachable corner not long after taking,
well let us be honest, seizing office by hook or crook.

Trump and the Republicans are threatening "war to the death," by any means, including the destruction of our constitutional government. The idea that they would attempt to impeach a newly-elected president BEFORE the president had done anything in office ... is bizarre, and pathetic.

Republicans contemplating such a strategy must contemplate the obvious: they may lose, and losing a war to the death .... or they may even win, and still die, in the armageddon such wars can create.

The Chinese aphorism "If you seek revenge, first dig two graves" applies.

I don't think the Republicans have ever forgiven the Clintons for stealing, in their minds, the presidency from Bush senior and ending 12 years of Republican control. Too add insult to injury under Bill Clinton the economy grew, the deficit shrank, and he raised taxes on the wealthy and closed military bases. No matter what they threw at him he bounced back.

They are experiencing a sense of deja vu. First Trump stole the Republican primary from the heir apparent Jeb Bush and now Hillary is stealing the presidency from them.

Frankly I'm glad Hillary is going to be the next president. Bernie is too far to the left and let's face it, Trump is nuts. As long as the Republican party is going to throw a temper tantrum and refuse to govern we need a grown-up in the presidency. Hillary is smarter than they are and she will minimize the damage they might do.
This is like holding a gun to the head of our government and saying "vote for us or we pull the trigger."

This is what I refer to as the "sand box" strategy.  The Republicans have been doing this for a while, but now it is on steroids.  If they can't win, except by gerrymandering, they will take the ball and leave the sand box.  They won't let anybody else play - petulant children are what they are.

The person who continuously claims the election is rigged... is right! He and his embittered surrogates and supporters are doing everything possible to deter and mislead opposition voters, fabricate, announce and conduct ill- or unfounded investigations of Clinton with the apparent willing collaboration of rogue FBI agents and at least Comey's unwitting assistance, and in general run anything but a principled policy-based campaign. Elected Republicans at the federal level are only too happy, for many obvious reasons, to acquiesce in these tactics if not to embrace them eagerly and publicly. The impeachment threat has been on the table for some days; it's not new. Republicans would rather do this than actually govern. These are hate-filled people and the perfect allies with the hate-filled Trump. Our long-standing governing dynamic has been perverted. It's having an observable pernicious and degrading effect on our nation. It certainly has affected me. I'm an independent who can not stomach Trump and his ilk, but for the first time I realize that I actually detest Trump and what he's done and is doing to our nation. As sympathetic as I am to the plight of some of his supporters (while others deserve none) I see no justification for or value from a Trump presidency. None. Directly or indirectly, he is harming us all and is damaging our nation.

People may wonder what government functions like when there aren't enough Republicans to block each and every piece of sensible legislation. Take a look at California where Republicans are now a rump minority. The state is prospering by every indicator, legislation is passing, government is serving the citizenry. You want a contrast? Take a hard look at Kansas: the good voters of Kansas put slash and burn Tea Party Republicans in power, led by Sam Brownback. Result? The state is hobbled with debt, dysfunction and a devastated public education system.
Democrats believe government has a productive, beneficial role to play in a functioning democracy, Republicans don't. The choice has never been so stark.

I am shocked! shocked! that Republicans would threaten impeachment without charges against a woman who is not yet president. Yeah, uh, really shocked. What I am really astonished at is the naïveté of too many of my fellow liberals who do not quite grasp that we are in a civil war.

The sons and daughters of the Confederacy realize they cannot overthrow the country by direct military action (been there, tried that) so they will stop at nothing to subvert every law and institution. They do this with the confidence that Democrats will merely whine but roll over, as they did with the Bush v. Gore decision.

Bill Clinton and Barack Obama began their respective terms with jovial outreach to Republicans which was the equivalent of sticking one's hand into a basket filled with rattle snakes. They got bit immediately and both administrations were nearly destroyed by Republican obstructionism. They learned their lesson.

I trust that Hillary is not so innocent at this late date and I wouldn't want her to be. By their own loud declarations and vile actions Republicans define themselves the enemy of civil democracy. I want Hillary to win, and I want, at long last, for the Democrats to take off their velvet gloves when dealing with this threat to the survival of the Republic.

Is it just me, or are these Republicans going totally zealot on us? I mean, what happened to reasonable people having reasonable discussions to resolve differences? That's what I thought most of my generation (I'm 57) was taught at home and at school. So where did my generation go? We were supposed to bring equality and empowerment to our government, remember? Is the country really now under the thumb of power-crazed madmen and -women who are driven to make everyone know that their way is the only way? Or the selfish, greed-sick politicians who take money from anyone in return for selling out the American people?
How could we stand by and watch as the GOP Southern Strategy created this massive group of down-trodden, angry Americans who are mostly just interested in creating a better future for their kids but are so misled and misinformed that any megalomaniac can waltz right in, throw some more fear at them, promise to be as unyielding and un-accepting as they now are and use their trust to go after the White House?
We fell asleep at the wheel, and shame on all of us, me included.
I am not proud to be an American, in front of the whole world, during this election cycle. We need to get the zealots from all sides out of office at home and in Washington and right this ship before its too late. The world needs us not to drop the ball, here. Too many millions of people are depending on us to continue lighting the way.
True.  And then he picks a VP.   Elizabeth Warren would be a good choice. Or maybe Bernie.

An astonishing dearth of diplomacy and decency plagued this election. Until politicians employ bipartisan solutions to America's problems with an emphasis on the common good, selfishness will shatter people's hope for a brighter future.

If you think government will completely come to a standstill if Hillary wins, imagine what will happen if Trump wins. His ideas are so out of touch with reality that constitutionally he will encounter numerous obstacles trying to implement what he says he wants. Add to that the very real possibility that HE could face impeachment. And not just b/c people don't like him. Just look at his behavior the past year and the lawsuits pending against him for any number of allegations--those are actual grounds for impeachment. Then consider the pushback he would face from the populace, from people from every walk of life to the press, academia, grass roots organizers, financial leaders. A Trump presidency would face a societal stoppage never seen before.

Let's face it: if the shoe were on the other foot, and the Democrats were in control of Congress and Trump poised to become President, the Democrats would be saying the same thing. This is what Clinton's backers don't seem to realize: Hillary Clinton is viewed, by Republicans, as every bit the existential threat that Donald Trump is by Democrats.

From the fact-free framework of lunacy on which they're operating, this impeachment business is a logical position to take. And therein lies the problem.

It's possible America has become ungovernable. There is simply nobody who is capable of reconciliation among factions of voters who would be acceptable to the system's gatekeepers -- the donor class.

Isn't what Trump and the Republicans are proposing extortion? "Vote for me or I will shut down your government." Its like the old mafia guys forcing shopkeepers to pay protection money. You want to be safe from me, pay me. Or, in this case, you want to be safe from me taking away your democracy, then vote for me.

That's not just immoral, unpatriotic, and illegal - it is treason.

This election has taken on the tone of a proxy civil war. Embittered, violent, demonizing rhetoric, and the sense that the loser's supporters will live as an occupied people, resisting "illegitimate" governance in every way possible.
How in the world did we, a resourceful, patriotic, educated society, reach this point of self-destruction?
Divided, we surely fall, and through the agency of a slovenly second rate demagogue, and those who have enabled him.

The Trumpkins promising to obstruct government if their guy does not win should make it clear to everyone that the GOP is now genuinely anti-democracy.  Over 50 million people voted for Obama but the GOP crew tried to keep him from doing any of the things those people voted for.  How is their attitude not the prelude to a coup d'etat?  By their actions they profoundly disrespect today's voters as well as the more than 600,000 Americans who died trying to preserve the Union in the Civil War. The GOP thinks it should never have to compromise.  They are not worthy to call themselves the party of Lincoln.  He compromised as needed to reach the higher goal of preserving the country.  Now the GOP rejects everything he stood for, and seeks to fragment the country.  They are the party of Nixon/Trump, not Lincoln.
"Fine looking country you got there.  Be a shame if something happened to it."

So, this is the part where the bully says ‘give me your lunch money or I’m gonna beat you up.’

Which makes Donald Trump, in essence, Draco Malfoy. Supporters of the pure-blood Slytherin DT, we’ll call Crabbe and Goyle.

I’ll be sticking with ‘Hermione’ Clinton. She was easily the smartest character in the book, the most studious, had the best time-management skills, and had the best interests of both muggles and pure-bloods at heart.

A vote for Mr. Trump would be a vote for a Death Eater. No can do.
